KnowledgeBase.Title: isString
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex

Function.Description: The isString function returns true is the argument is String. Otherwise, it returns false.

Brief.Overview: The isString Function returns true if the argument {obj} is a String; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isString function is used to query an object to see if it is of type String. An alternate method would be to use the isType function using the Type argument as type String.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory,
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex

Syntax.Return: If the object is type String or Text, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned
